column5: Oct 10  U.S. construction machinery maker Terex Corp   accelerating its foray into emerging markets  said it had agreed to acquire a majority stake in Ritz do Brazil  a maker of equipment for constructing and maintaining power lines.

column4: Teva to get EU approval for Cephalon buy: source
column5: BRUSSELS Teva Pharmaceutical Industries  is set to secure conditional EU clearance to acquire U.S. specialty drugmaker Cephalon Inc  for close to $7 billion  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

column4: Carlyle/Blackstone  THL are Morgan Keegan finalists
column5: NEW YORK Thomas H. Lee Partners and a consortium that includes Blackstone Group  and Carlyle Group  are finalists to acquire Regions Financial Corp's  Morgan Keegan brokerage and investment banking unit  sources familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Carlyle-Blackstone  THL finalists for Regions unit -sources
column5: Oct 10 Thomas H. Lee Partners and a consortium that includes Blackstone Group and Carlyle Groupare the finalists for Regions Financial Corp's  Morgan Keegan brokerage unit  sources familiar with the matter said.

column4: Time Warner  Vivendi to bid for Polish TVN: sources
column5: WARSAW Media groups Time Warner and Vivendi will likely place the only two binding bids for a controlling stake in Polish broadcaster TVN worth more than $800 million  three sources told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Time Warner  Vivendi to bid for Polish TVN-sources
column5: WARSAW  Oct 10 Media groups Time Warner  and Vivendi will likely place the only two binding bids for a controlling stake in Polish broadcaster TVN  worth more than $800 million  three sources told Reuters on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Harris Corp names United Tech executive as CEO
column5: Oct 10 Harris Corp   a supplier of telecommunications equipment  named a United Technologies Corp executive as its new president and chief executive  effective Nov. 1.

column4: UPDATE 2-S.Africa unions want Wal-Mart to boost supply fund
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Oct 10 Wal-Mart and Massmart should increase a planned fund to help South African suppliers to 500 million rand ($64 million) from 100 million  and be required to source more goods locally  South African unions said on Monday.

column4: China Wal-Mart stores to close over pork scandal
column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 10 Some Wal-Mart stores in the southwest city of Chongqing will close temporarily following accusations they sold ordinary pork as organic pork  Wal-Mart said on Monday.

column4: RPT-PREVIEW-Wal-Mart must finally show a U.S. rebound
column5: * U.S. same-store sales down for nine consecutive quarters

column4: S.Africa union wants Wal-Mart to boost supply fund
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Oct 10 Wal-Mart and Massmart should increase their planned fund to support South African suppliers to at least 500 million rand ($63.5 million) from 100 million rand  the country's largest service industry union said on Monday.
